org.jooby

Interface Route.Handler

  • Enclosing interface:
    Route

    public static interface Route.Handler
    A route handler/callback. 
     public class MyApp extends Jooby {
   {
      get("/", (req, rsp)  -> rsp.send("Hello"));
   }
 }
    Please note that a handler is allowed to throw errors. If a service throws an exception you should NOT catch it, unless of course you want to apply logic or do something special. In particular you should AVOID wrapping exception: 
       {
      get("/", (req, rsp)  -> {
        Service service = req.getInstance(Service.class);
        try {
          service.doSomething();
        } catch (Exception ex) {
         throw new RuntimeException(ex);
        }
      });
   }
    Previous is bad example of exception handling and should avoid wrapping exception. If you do that, exception become hard to ready and the stack trace get too damn long. So, if you wont do anything with the exception: DONT' catch it. Jooby will catch, logged and send an appropriated status code and response.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle(Request request, Response response)
      Callback method for a HTTP request.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        void handle(Request request,
            Response response)
     throws Exception
        Callback method for a HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        request - A HTTP request.
        response - A HTTP response.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong. The exception will processed by Jooby.
